column1: I will never forget the special moment I shared with my daughter CeCe honoring the extraordinary life of President George H.W. Bush as he laid in state in the Capitol. This week I was proud to support a bill commemorating the lives of former President Bush & First Lady Bush. https://t.co/ofptagJgEB

ICYMI: Check out my piece in the Morning Consult addressing one of the greatest risks facing our financial institutions today: cyberattacks. Click here to learn more and read about the bill I introduced prioritizing cybersecurity efforts → https://t.co/eF9tbJoYMF

Staff will be holding office hours in #LincolnCounty for #NC10 constituents TOMORROW from 9 AM-12 PM. Come to Gaston College's Cochrane Science & Technology Building—511 South Aspen Street in Lincolnton—with questions & concerns. Click here for details → https://t.co/x7RTnTZ8hK

Today the Senate sent the #USMCA to the President’s desk. This trade deal is a win for #NC10 textile manufactures and for our economy. Great to see President @realDonaldTrump fulfill another promise to American workers and businesses. https://t.co/s2TuZ9FMBo

I was proud to join @realDonaldTrump yesterday as he signed the Phase One agreement w/ China. I look forward to continuing to work with the President to fight for better trade w/ China so we protect #NC10 jobs & ensure our already booming economy maintains its success globally. https://t.co/BA6ft6mIVn

The entire impeachment process has been a politically-motivated sham that has kept Congress from doing actual work that would benefit the American people. Read my statement on voting against sending the articles of impeachment to the Senate here: https://t.co/y7LSQ2lt37

Tune in as @RealDonaldTrump signs the Phase One agreement with China. I am proud to join him at the @WhiteHouse and I look forward to continuing to work with him as he fulfills his promise to fight for better trade with China. https://t.co/8vsiHrxH17
I look forward to joining @HalRowWHKY tomorrow morning at 8:30 to provide an update on the goings on in Washington and what it means for #NC10. https://t.co/l2My5liTBS

This is a sad day for #AVL & #WNC. I have always enjoyed my conversations with @PeteKaliner. He will be missed on the airwaves in our area. I wish him the very best in the next chapter of his life. https://t.co/m8BcKSHu2W

Last night the House passed a bill I introduced to help ensure our nation’s financial system is protected against the growing threat of cyberattacks. Click here to learn more about my bill that ensures regulators are prioritizing cybersecurity → https://t.co/JQzr4lA0bJ https://t.co/C5NzY5iptD

This morning I joined @Varneyco to discuss Democrats’ silence over the protest in Iran. I will always be proud to stand behind @realDonaldTrump as he takes decisive action against sworn enemies of our nation https://t.co/wvoOBbEeNB

Congratulations to Gastonia native and fellow @AshbrookHS alum Wes Helms on being named the manager for the Charlotte @KnightsBaseball for the upcoming season. Welcome home Wes! #NC10 #CLTKnights https://t.co/GkQDhQ0dVz

Today as we celebrate #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay please join me in thanking our hometown heroes for everything they do to protect our communities and keep our families safe here in #NC10 and all across the country. God bless you for all you do to protect this great nation. https://t.co/ozXyDcT1Uj

I am proud to stand behind a Commander in Chief who is willing to take decisive action against sworn enemies of our nation and who continues to protect and defend our freedoms. https://t.co/s0YED89O41

I am thankful no Americans were injured in last night’s attacks on U.S. military bases. Please join me in praying for the brave men and women of the U.S. military who continue to put their lives on the line to help keep our country safe → https://t.co/AemgHOmnin
Happy New Year! Giulia Cecelia Rese and I wish everyone in the Tenth District a happy healthy and prosperous 2020. God Bless! https://t.co/chViM6DJLz

From scheduling tours of the Capitol to helping you with your questions and casework with federal agencies like the VA I am proud of the work my office has done on behalf of the people of #NC10 over the past year. It is an honor to serve you as your Congressman. https://t.co/dCxsJBgUGK

Rob Williford now travels the world with country star Luke Combs but like me he has never forgotten his #GastonCounty roots. It was fun to read about how he was inspired to become a musician right here in Gastonia → https://t.co/zAcqUfXP1m

Merry Christmas #NC10! This year I wanted to share a brief video to celebrate the Christmas season and to ask you to join me in praying for all those who have sacrificed time at home with their loved ones so we can be with ours. https://t.co/j3JnnWN2V5

Anyone who has been to McAdenville during the holiday season knows why they earned the nickname of Christmas Town USA. This year they won second place in USA Today’s national contest to determine the best holiday lights. Congratulations! https://t.co/aSQFOOhhoW

I am always thankful for #NC10 law enforcement & everything they do to keep us safe. Congratulations to #ClevelandCounty Sheriff Alan Norman who received a state award honoring those dedicated to keeping communities safe healthy and happy → https://t.co/Pt3Xr5qeS0

Two years ago we fulfilled our promise to provide tax relief for families and small businesses like those I represent the in #NC10. Since we fixed the broken tax code we’ve seen record low unemployment a booming economy and more jobs thanks to the #TaxCutandJobsAct. #TCJA2year https://t.co/6I29TpC6tJ

Yesterday @GOPLeader Kevin McCarthy Whip @SteveScalise and my colleagues on the @FinancialCmte joined me as we took a positive step towards making the CFPB accountable and improving the agency’s structure for the good of all American consumers. https://t.co/lSpBUP44Fm

Passage of the #USMCA is a win for #NC10 textile manufactures and a win for our economy. Thank you @POTUS for getting this done! Read my full statement on House passage of the USMCA here → https://t.co/HzxNsOfFAr

Tonight we saw the culmination of @HouseDemocrats yearlong fiercely partisan effort to undo the will of the American people and remove @POTUS from office. My full statement on this sad day for the House → https://t.co/GxTR7wwS3U

Today I delivered a speech to denounce this sham impeachment vote. Rather than pursuing the priorities of the American people @HouseDemocrats have chosen to focus on partisan political games aimed at undoing the 2016 election. It is a sad day for this institution. https://t.co/fjAUYifOtK

As we start voting on @HouseDemocrats impeachment sham the question we are all asking is: how did we get here? Take a look at this timeline from @SteveScalise highlighting how Dems have wanted to remove @POTUS from office since the day he was elected → https://t.co/2vGHHIB5eU

Speaker Pelosi and @HouseDemocrats continue with their fiercely partisan impeachment process. I will be voting against these politically-motivated attacks against @realDonaldTrump whenever they come before the full House. https://t.co/K7p7vfP9Ux

Today we could be voting on HR 19 a bipartisan bill that would help lower drug costs for all Americans while promoting innovation and enabling us to work towards #MoreCures. Instead we are voting on the opposite. Learn more here → https://t.co/9LN80fvOf8

Today I voted to give our troops their biggest raise in a decade and help ensure our military remains the best in the world. Read my full statement on passage of the bipartisan #NDAA below: https://t.co/vlySzDaYom

American workers have waited long enough the time to pass the #USMCA is now. From enabling our economy to continue to grow to the jobs it will help create there is no excuse not to pass this trade deal and give a win to these hardworking men and women → https://t.co/fsNtLM0Fzd

At every turn House Democrats have ignored facts and created a sham process just to get the results they have wanted since the 2016 election. The articles of impeachment announced today are no different → https://t.co/nXTf7M15qt

I am saddened to hear of the passing of former Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker. He devoted his life to public service and diligently steered our nation through times of economic uncertainty. My thoughts are with his loved ones at this difficult time. https://t.co/InSfjpFOHc

Despite what some House Democrats may claim they have been trying to undermine @POTUS since before he took office. The impeachment hearings are just the latest in a long list of excuses they are using to try and overturn the will of the American people → https://t.co/zgSgBdQSgw

December 7th is a day our nation will never forget. Please join me in honoring the lives lost at Pearl Harbor on this fateful day 78 years ago. Thank you to the brave men and women who answered the call to defend our nation and for all who continue to answer that call today. https://t.co/DOrHtfk1CR

There is nothing but good news in the latest jobs report: unemployment is down wages are up and over 250000 jobs were added in November. Great to see the positive impacts tax reform and @POTUS’s pro-growth policies are still having on our economy → https://t.co/3mNCbUWxfQ
Giulia and I wish George Lucy and the entire Holding family all the best as they move into this next stage of their lives.

Personally he is one of my favorite people and someone I consider to be a true friend. While I am disappointed to see George leave the House I am confident his time serving the people of North Carolina is not over.

In a very short time he became a master of the legislative process working on the Ways and Means Committee to cut taxes for all Americans. More importantly George is a fantastic human being who is well-liked by members on both sides of the aisle.
Today is a sad day for the people of North Carolina and the House as a whole. @RepHolding is a dedicated public servant—first as a federal prosecutor and now as a Congressman—with a brilliant mind.

It has now been more than a year since @POTUS signed the #USMCA to help create American jobs and boost our economy. It is past time House Democrats put their partisan games aside to get this done → https://t.co/dyWfmiwVJo

Many of our brave servicemen and women have sacrificed time with their families during the holidays to help defend the freedoms we enjoy here at home. Today I joined @RedCross to write letters that will be sent to our heroes serving overseas thanking them for their service. https://t.co/2rZYbKb6xL

Sorry to hear this. @RepDennyHeck is a fine legislator who I've enjoyed working with on @FinancialCmte. While we have often disagreed we always did so with respect and usually humor. https://t.co/cJsGRFgC2i

House Democrats don’t have any evidence so why are they still refusing to end the sham impeachment process? Because they are willing to ignore the facts as long as they are able to achieve their goal of removing President Trump from office → https://t.co/GPOD6swotB

.@RiverboatRonHC is a good guy who did a lot for our community on the field & off. While it is disappointing to see him get fired it is great to see #NC10 native Perry Fewell finally getting a NFL head coaching opportunity. Learn more about Coach Fewell from the @theobserver. https://t.co/yV3hp84QN1

Over the past 6 months the people of Hong Kong have protested against China’s efforts to undermine their democracy. I applaud @POTUS for signing legislation supporting Hong Kong. These bills send a strong message to China: we will always support freedom → https://t.co/RMNo0yLxRZ

Here in #NC10 small businesses play a vital role in helping our communities and economy grow. Today to celebrate Small Business Saturday I wanted to share my story about one small business that changed my life. #ShopSmall https://t.co/PkUh5uxD6M

Happy Thanksgiving to everyone here in #NC10. As we enjoy this holiday with friends and family please join me in giving thanks for everything that makes our country the best in the world. May God continue to bless America. https://t.co/kMuEpFqvfd

This proves once again that Democrats don't care about the process even if it means violating Americans' private information as long as they achieve their goal of impeaching the President. Click here to read the letter → https://t.co/qQC551JH4w

Although the documents were obtained through subpoenas issued by Chairwoman Waters to advance her “long-standing interest in impeaching the President” none of the documents received to date are related to the President or his financial records.

ICYMI: I sent a letter signed by every one of my fellow @FinancialCmte Republicans to Chairwoman Waters expressing our concern that the impeachment process is violating the privacy of American citizens’ personal financial information.

This year a turkey from #NC received the official pardon from @POTUS. Learn more about the two turkeys Bread and Butter who came all the way to the White House to participate in this time-honored tradition → https://t.co/7MG9vxBQ2V

ICYMI: This week I sent a letter to Treasury Secertary Mnuchin urging him to analyze the potential negative impact of a financial transaction tax #FTT on the U.S. economy and everyday investors. Learn more about my letter here from @FoxBusiness → https://t.co/wJ67B0pE7R

Last week #GastonCounty lost one of its heroes. Since he enlisted in the U.S. Marines during WWII at just 16 years old Mack Drake lived his life dedicated to defending the United States to his family and to his fellow veterans →  https://t.co/FSS3RlBBji

First the @WhiteHouse issues a veto threat on HR 4863 & now @senatemajldr McConnell says it's going nowhere in the Senate. Rather than wasting our time w/ a partisan ExIm bill @HouseDemocrats should bring up our bipartisan bill that confronts the grave threats posed by China. https://t.co/PiECnWBkpU

Although we celebrated #VeteransDay Monday we should celebrate the service and sacrifice of men and women like Mary Tate of Hickory every day. She recently shared her experience serving in the Women’s Army Corps during WWII with the @Hickoryrecord → https://t.co/tw8gIl3mV5

Incredible story from the @gastongazette on Army Cpl. Earl W. Duncan who finally returned home to #GastonCounty after he went missing in Korea almost 70 years ago. We will never forget his sacrifice or the sacrifice of all who have served → https://t.co/vK9kElHcTO
I know he will be missed by the people of NY-02 & his colleagues in Washington. I wish Pete Rosemary & their entire family well as they move on to the next stage of their lives.

There is no better example of this than Pete’s tireless advocacy for 9/11 first responders. I will always remember his passion &  dedication to these brave men & women as he fought to ensure the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund was permanently authorized.

Throughout my time in Congress I have had the pleasure of working closely with @RepPeteKing. He always fought with the grit & determination you would expect of a New Yorker but he was also an adept legislative strategist who worked in a bipartisan fashion to achieve results.

Today is #VeteransDay a day to celebrate and honor all who have served. I am thankful for the almost 50000 veterans who call #NC10 home and all of our nation's heroes for everything they have done to keep our country safe. https://t.co/WyYEsutwxM

Happy Birthday to the @USMC! Since our country’s founding the United States Marines have been defending our nation and its freedoms. Please join me today in honoring these brave men and women. Thank you to all of our Marines for their service! https://t.co/WvnGvB4Grk

We need the #USMCA here in #NC10. Trade with Canada and Mexico supports 32000 jobs in #NC alone. So why are House Democrats so focused on partisan political games instead of voting on a trade deal that will help improve lives here in #WNC and all across the country? https://t.co/ena55h81Gl

This weekend I was honored to attend the funeral of Pfc. Jack Burke who was killed in action while serving in the @USMC during #WWII. This year his body was finally identified so he could return home to #NC. Read about this incredible story here → https://t.co/wVhxffrf12

Beyond his work as a public servant I’ll always think of Greg for his commitment to his family. He is a devoted husband and father who has always put his family first. I wish Greg and Mylene all the best as they move on to this next stage of their lives.
He helped maintain our historic majorities while leading the NRCC and later helped shepherd consequential legislation—like the SUPPORT Act—to passage as Chairman of the Energy and Commerce Committee.

.@repgregwalden is unquestionably one of the most intelligent and substantive members with whom I’ve served during my time in Congress. For the past two decades he’s been on the frontlines of some of our party's most important political and policy battles.
My prayers are with her family and loved ones as they grieve her passing.

Saddened to hear of the passing of former Senator Kay Hagan. Although we may have been in opposite chambers during the time we served together in Congress I always found Kay to be a kind and approachable public servant committed to serving our shared home state. https://t.co/B3FlGKLASG
Thankful as well to our military leaders and @realDonaldTrump for continuing to follow through on their commitment to fully eliminate ISIS and terrorists around the globe.

Great news for our country & the world. I'm thankful for our special operators whose bravery & skill made this action possible. Shows once again that we have the greatest military in the world. God bless all those who serve. https://t.co/GqkeZ4Ogtw
